title: What The Sam Hell Was That?!
body:
Watching Live Stream ESports; They let a team CHANGE THEIR LAST PICKS. After the timers expired! What the hell is that? How is that possible? Am I mistaken? Mulligan is why I hated MTG, if you're gonna walk into bad picks because you couldn't make up your minds, do it with dignity. I don't enjoy seeing that at all.

If it was real. Was it? Do they let tournament players do this?!

replies.body:
There is a brief (3ish second) of latency. They aren't letting them change it is just a spectator latency.

That is why they have Refs (multiple on each side watching each team) to ensure rules are followed. Say a pause and team not talking during a pause, etc.
